newsitem.title: USA: U.S. freight forwarder Deringer to acquire Maron.
newsitem.headline: U.S. freight forwarder Deringer to acquire Maron.

text.p: A.N. Deringer Inc, the privately held global transportation company, is to acquire Maron Shipping Agency Inc in a move designed to strengthen Deringer's freight forwarding business, the company said in a statement.
The purchase results in additional facilities for Deringer in Miami and New York, Deringer vice president Wayne Burl said.

The Maron managment team will continue as Deringer employees. Maron executive, Bill Maron, has been appointed director of ocean exports, while Dave Harlem will continue to oversee operations in Miami.
Maron Shipping was founded in 1946 and is recognized as a leading freight forwarder in the ports of New York and Miami.
A.N. Deringer, based in Vermont, has 33 offices in the U.S.
